Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Pilosulin 3 (Myr b III)(antss, natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E. coli and S. aureus (MIC < 25 uM),  B. subtilis (MIC <50 uM), not active against  P.aeruginosa, C.albicans, S.cerevisiae, and L.garvieae. Also a histamine-releasing peptide. See AP890 for an updated view on this peptide component. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Inagaki H, Akagi M, Imai HT, Taylor RW, Kubo T2004
Literature Information.Title: Molecular cloning and biological characterization of novel antimicrobial peptides, pilosulin 3 and pilosulin 4, from a species of the Australian ant genus Myrmecia.
